author: hudsonjameson
content:
The agenda was just updated to include a special note from <@!187490121698770945> and I about YOLOv2. It says the following:

ACD Note for YOLOv2 (From: Hudson and James):

We want to focus on what should be included in YOLOv2 rather than what is officially going into Berlin because there are things like benchmarking and further evaluation of CFI (considered for inclusion) EIPs that usually advance an EIP from CFI to Accepted.

We recommend considering the following EIPs for YOLOv2. Note that not all of these EIPs are in CFI, but are to be discussed in ACD Meeting #95.

- [EIP-2046: Reduced gas cost for static calls made to precompiles](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2046).
- [EIP-2315: Simple Subroutines for the EVM](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2315).
- [EIP-2537: Precompile for BLS12-381 curve operations](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2537) (already in YOLOv1).
- [EIP-2711: Sponsored, expiring and batch transactions](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2711).
- [EIP 2718: Typed Transaction Envelope](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-2718.md) (general-purpose standard for adding new transaction types).
- [EIP-2565: Repricing of the EIP-198 ModExp precompile](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2565).
- [EIP-2929: Gas cost increases for state access opcodes](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-2929.md).
- [EIP-2930: Optional access lists](https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-2930.md).
- [EIP-2935: Save historical block hashes in state](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2935).

author: hudsonjameson
content: I encourage everyone to check out the agenda and these EIPs pre-call if possible.

author: shamatar
content: 2046 can be potentially unsafe without 2666. Iâ€™ll try to work it to the merging point before the call

author: shamatar
content: There is also a possibility for a trivial fix for Geth that makes BnAdd fast enough to eliminate dependency between 2046 and 2666

author: _shemnon
content: even with the Geth fix I view 2666 as a required companion EIP for 2046.

author: axic3354
content:
I'd still prefer this approach: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/162#issuecomment-608471710

Reason: I don't think we can do all the repricing in one update if the galore of EIPs listed above take precedence. And doing just a safe version of 2046 would be a significant improvement already. The individual precompile repricings I think are cherry on the cake (compared to the staticcall change). I may be wrong and having some example gas costs for actually happening use cases would be nice to see (whether the call cost overhead is a significant contributor or not).

author: shamatar
content: Actually https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/21515 solves for Geth, so 2046 can go standalone with a constant of 100 (Besu requirement)

author: shamatar
content: Repricing of hash functions is a fix to make pricing consistent with actual amount of computations, e.g. any Keccak256 between 0 and 135 bytes will take the same time to compute, while at the moment it's 4 times cost difference for nothing as "per data", as well as twice higher "one-off" cost then necessary. While latter is just a convenience for end-users it is still much smaller amount of work then 2929/2930
